elements.title: killed as a result of active service in the First World War (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at least 78 British general officers were killed as a result of active service in the First World War (gravestone of one pictured), but a popular myth holds that general officers rarely visited the battlefield?

elements.title: Ismail Suko (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ismail Suko was elected governor of Riau in 1985, then forced to resign before taking office?

elements.title: 2022 Famous Idaho Potato Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eastern Michigan's only bowl-game victory before defeating San Jose State in the 2022 Famous Idaho Potato Bowl was against San Jose State in the 1987 California Bowl?

elements.title: Kimiko Hirata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that campaigning by climate activist Kimiko Hirata halted plans to build 17 new coal-fired power plants following the Fukushima nuclear disaster in Japan?

elements.title: Carsosaurus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the only known specimen of the Cretaceous lizard Carsosaurus contains preserved embryos?

elements.title: Kenneth Powell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Anglo-Indian sprinter Kenneth Powell was the first sportsperson from Karnataka to win the Arjuna Award?

elements.title: Casablanca Protocol (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Casablanca Protocol was the only binding instrument of the Arab League that addressed the status of Palestinian refugees?

elements.title: Max Wenner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that exactly how "man of mystery" Max Wenner fell from an airliner flying over Belgium remains a mystery?
